title: Game becomes unplayable 30 minutes in.
body:
So I can run League of legends just fine, My ping is alright my fps is stable.
But anywhere from 30 minutes in and after my game will suddenly stop working, and I don't mean the client freezes I mean my character refuses to move and allies/enemies start rubber banding all over the map with abilities firing off, Going back to freezing in place and then moving to whatever location they've moved to in the past 10 seconds of me not being able to see anything in real time.

Its strange that its consistently after that amount of time in game, It doesn't happen anytime before this "time limit" and the game doesn't lag or stutter at all before either because it never has on my computer. I read that it may be my GPU overheating but I've felt it at the time it does this and its never even all that warm plus only League of legends seems affected by this or any problem.

Thanks for any and all suggestions or help.

replies.body:
What you're describing sounds like heavy packet loss late into the game. Packets are the bits of information that tell the server what actions were taken and the ones you receive relay to you what happened with other's actions on the server. If these are lost along the way, it can delay actions that you see or prevent them from even happening.

Packet loss is often caused by issues along your route to the server, or local network settings that conflict with League. I recommend working through our [connection troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) as a first step in resolving this issue.

Let me know if you have any issues after following those steps.
